alert.note: Alert for Hughes; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Coal, eastern Seminole, northeastern Pontotoc and Hughes Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 908 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bearden to 4 miles north of Atwood to 6 miles northeast of Stonewall. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holdenville, Wewoka, Wetumka, Allen, Dustin, Calvin, Cromwell, Stuart, Lamar, Gerty, Horntown, Yeager, Atwood and Spaulding. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 209 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
